case_title: ALI AND 3 OTHERS vs THE STATE
reference_no_or_id: Criminal Appeal No. 237 and Confirmation Case No. 60 of 1967
complaint_summary: Sajawal, brother of deceased Mahmud, reported that four appellants and two unidentified individuals armed with guns entered their courtyard and shot Mahmud dead. The incident was motivated by blood-feud between the parties.
investigation_summary: Police recovered 13 empties, live cartridges, blood-stained earth, and a shoe from the crime scene. Autopsy confirmed gunshot wounds caused instant death. Weapons were recovered from accused individuals, and forensic analysis was inconclusive due to tampering concerns.
judgment_summary: The court found discrepancies in witness testimonies and flaws in corroborative evidence, including tampered forensic samples. The plea of alibi for Arbab and Ramzan was deemed plausible. The court acquitted all appellants, granting them the benefit of doubt.

final_decision.description: The appellants were acquitted of all charges and their convictions and sentences were set aside.
final_decision.details: The death sentences for Durro and Arbab were not confirmed. Any fines paid were ordered to be refunded.

legal_arguments: Plausibility of alibi for Arbab and Ramzan

key_points.description: The appellants were related and had a history of blood feuds with the complainant party.
The prosecution alleged that the appellants committed murder during a nighttime attack.
Eyewitness testimony was inconsistent and lacked credibility.
The plea of alibi raised by Arbab and Ramzan was supported by police station diary entries but was rejected by the trial court.
The recovery of firearms and other evidence was deemed unreliable due to procedural flaws.
The court found the prosecution's case insufficient to establish guilt beyond reasonable doubt.

witness_statement.Sajawal: Identified appellants and reported the incident.
witness_statement.Mst. Sadori: Provided details of the incident but showed discrepancies in testimony.
witness_statement.Bakhairo: Corroborated identification of appellants but showed inconsistencies.
witness_statement.A.S.I. Ali Nawaz: Recovered evidence from the crime scene.

maxims.Benefit of Doubt: Accused must be acquitted if evidence does not establish guilt beyond reasonable doubt.

legal_terms.Alibi: A claim or evidence that the accused was elsewhere when the alleged act took place.
legal_terms.Corroboration: Additional evidence that confirms or supports a statement or finding.

words_and_phrases.Hakal: A shout or call used to alert or challenge someone.

summary_vector_notes: The case involved a murder motivated by blood-feud. Witness testimonies were inconsistent, and forensic evidence was tampered with. The court found the alibi plausible and acquitted all appellants.
